newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee weakens on dollar, pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee weakens on dollar, pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee weakened slightly against the dollar and pound on Tuesday, foreign exchange dealers said.

The rupee was quoted at a mean commercial rate of 20.066 against the dollar from 20.021 last Thursday. Against the pound, the rupee traded at a mean of 32.9160 for one pound from 32.8865 last Thursday.
Banks in Mauritius were closed on Friday and Monday for public holidays.
Dealers said the rupee's fixing on Tuesday was in line with the dollar's trend in overnight international markets.
They added foreign exchange positions in a couple of commercial banks were becoming slightly short as demand from importers picked up after an end of year lull.
"A couple of banks have already signalled intentions to buy (dollars) from the interbank forex market. This shows they are getting short," one dealer said.
